description.narrative: The Idai Acute Crisis Joint Response provides humanitarian assistance to communities following the impact of Cyclone Idai in Malawiand Mozambique. Oxfam works together with AJOAGO to implement the programme in Mozambique AJOAGO will implement a WaSH intervention, increasing water supply and improving the hygiene situation in Buzi district of Sofala Province. Water supply systems will be rehabilitated and flooded sources will be cleaned and desinfected. Water committees will work in communities on hygiene and sanitation related issues to prevent waterborne diseases. Recently, Mozambique has faced since 2016 a severe drought in Southern and Central region of the country affecting approximately 814 thousands people in Tete, Sofala, Gaza and Inhambane Provinces. Due to seriousness ofthe situation the Government activated institutional orange alert seeking for donors to mobilize additional resources and expand their efforts on response actions. In 2016 -17, Oxfam in Mozambique as a member of the COSACA consortium responded to the crisis in terms of immediate life-saving and life-sustaining activities through provision of essential food and seed commodities, livelihoods, and WASH activities. In 2017/18 Sida funded COSACA for the drought recovery phase of the program. Oxfam activities were focused in Govuro district of Inhambane Province on WASH. To ensure sustainability and better capacity in response to emergencies from local organizations and communities, Oxfam intends to support AJOAGO to fulfill thisdesideratum. Forming the local communities and the Government executive arm in the emergency response..
